name: Sheraton Lincoln Harbor Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed one night due to business meeting. My company had negotiated a good rate which included parking. Very clean and comfortable room with what appears to be an updated bathroom. Lobby staff very helpful and welcoming. I walked around for a while to enjoy the NYC skyline and felt comfortable in the area. I would stay here again - at my corporate rate.
reviews.title: Very nice for business travel

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was excellent. The rooms are clean and modern. Lots of options to dine. For a trip to New York this is an excellent place. The options to get to NYC are plenty. It is a short drive to Lincoln tunnel, it is also very close to the light rail station, a few stops away from Hobokken. From there the path train connections to WTC and 33rd street are very good. It is also close to the Ferry terminal. The hotel has spectacular views of NYC. It is also the best place to stay for the Macy's fireworks on 4th of July.
reviews.title: Excellet hotel

reviews.text: From the front desk to housekeeping, the staff at this hotel could not have been nicer! Rooms were large by NYC standards, and ours on the Club Floor (thanks to a front desk upgrade) had spectacular views of the Hudson and NYC skyline. The 6-minute ferry to Midtown is literally outside the hotel's door ($9 o/w), which makes it perfect if you're driving to NY for business or pleasure and want a larger hotel space, and nice views and reasonable prices.But I wasn't there to see the city this time; I booked the hotel as a central meeting point for a family get-together. The hotel's indoor pool (max. 5' deep) was perfect for our needs, plus it's open from 8a-11p, and there were times we had it to ourselves. We didn't use the adjacent workout room, but I saw plenty of machines and free weights. The Club itself didn't offer much in the way of afternoon or evening snacks compared to Clubs I've stayed in elsewhere, but the Continental breakfast was certainly adequate. There is an Italian restaurant onsite with a decent menu, including a variety of yummy salads large enough to share or eat as a main dish. A special thank you to the restaurant staff, who were very accommodating to my young special-needs nephew!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Suprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hoboken's charming restaurants and shops are a 5-minute drive, but we didn't the need to leave the premises. Had it not been raining, we would walked along the hotel's waterfront pathway. Instead, we gazed out our room windows at stunning NYC waterfront views.
reviews.title: Great hotel for NYC car trip!

reviews.text: A big THANK YOU to the Reservations Staff, Front Desk Staff, Club Room Staff, Housekeeping, and Maintenance Staff!! You helped us make some very happy family memories. We will be back!!
reviews.title: Better than staying in Manhatten.

reviews.text: Having stayed at our share of four-star Manhattan hotels, we were pleasantly surprised by the generous size of the room at the Sheraton given the price we paid. Our room even had a sitting area - the extra space is nice to have when traveling with two toddlers. It is an easy ferry ride or bus ride into Manhattan. Most mornings, we would jump on a ferry and go into Manhattan and then take the free shuttle service provided by the ferry to get to where we want to go. The only inconvenience is that the ferry service does not run very late into the night, so be prepared to have another way to come back if you are planning on staying in Manhattan for a late night.
reviews.title: Comfortable room yet so close to NY
Nice place!
reviews.text: We stayed here during the 4th of July holiday. A great hotel to watch the fireworks if on the Husdon river side. Our room was very spacious and very clean. The only issue we had was with the hostess at their restaurant. We knew it was a busy night, the night of the 4th. We asked her where we could get a quick bite to eat since the restaurant had an hour wait. She just named all the other very crowded restaurants in the area. We wish she could have mentioned the food court from the beginning. It would have saved us a lot of time.

Pros: Our rate included ferry tickets to Manhattan, so this was a good deal. The ferry service (5 min crossing to Midtown) also provides free bus/shuttle service to Times Square area and Downtown. Room had great view of Downtown, rooms were recently updated, comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Great view and easy access to Manhattan

reviews.text: Cons: NO FREE wifi in the rooms!!!! They charged $10/day, which you must factor in when comparing prices. Room had not been vacuumed (crumbs from previous guest) and did not get vacuumed all 4 days of our stay. TV remotes were bad. No free breakfast and no grocery store of any kind close by. Also, a guest on our floor brought a dog, which pooped in the hallway (several times). I know this isn't the fault of the hotel, but I was not aware I'd be staying in a hotel with pets.
reviews.title: Very nice but don't overpay
What a room!
reviews.text: The Sheraton is a very nice hotel with the usual four star amenities. I still balk at the $10 internet room charge, but that's not usual these days. Use the free area in the lobby. Rooms are spacious and most have a good view of NYC. Would be nice if there was a fridge in the room. No free breakfast, again not unusual so we ordered the continental breakfast delivered to the room. Quality of the food was pretty good. We paid the $25 fee for parking both nights, but we got a great deal on the room from Hotwire. We took the light rail to Hoboken, then the PATH train into the city. This is a cheap way to go but of course, it's not as a fast as taking the ferry right outside the hotel. Overall, the staff was great and the hotel looks like it's being maintained well.

reviews.title: Wonderful in every way!
reviews.text: Best way to visit new york city and stay at a wonderful hotel in New Jersey. At the entrance to the Lincoln Tunnel. Delightful ferry boat 8 minute ride across the Hudson to 39th Street. Free bus into the theatre district and back again to the ferry. Hotel staff was top notch. Great restaurant in the hotel for big breakfast and wonderful view of the city. Can't say enough good things about our experience. Best kept secret!
Judy N.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely liked this hotel!!! That was my first time in USA (I'm from Slovenia - Europe) and I was very surprised how the staff of this hotel was friendly with us. We got 2 very spacious rooms with view on Manhattan - one had a king size bed and other a queen size bed, and they were both very spacious. I have to compliment the breakfast, because that was the best breakfast we ever had! We could order everythink we wanted - eggs, fruit, oatmeal, pancakes,... and everythink was included in the voucher (we had free breakfast because we made a reservation before 30.3.2007). I was also impressed because this hotel has a free shuttle that takes you to the ferry. Ferry is not so expensive (7USD for one way and 14USD for a return ticket) and it takes you to Manhattan in cca. 6 or 7 minutes.
reviews.title: Run down and dirty

reviews.text: So this hotel is absolutely a good choice!
reviews.title: The Sheraton Wasn't the Best Buy

reviews.text: Not a great experience. The rooms are old and dirty. The sofa and chairs were so dirty that we had to cover them with sheets. The TV was a 10-year old GE that didn't work. They replaced it with another one that was worse. The location is not good, far from shops or restaurants. The only positive thing about this hotel is that it's close to the NY ferry dock. I have stayed at several Sheraton hotels. This was the worst I have seen. I will not go back.
reviews.title: Good Location ... Mediocre Experience

reviews.text: I was in town for business and stayed at the Sheraton Lincoln Harbor Hotel. I felt very safe, the staff was helpful and friendly. My room was clean and had a fantastic view of the harbor. It was a little pricey ($350 with tax) but other than that I have no complaints about this hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone staying in the Weehawken/Hoboken area!
reviews.title: Pricey but a great place to stay!
Great price, room and location for being so close to NYC
reviews.text: The Lincoln Harbor Sheraton was wonderful. We had a big, clean room with a view of the lower Manhattan skyline. The hotel has a ferry stop at its door step so you can be in midtown within six minutes. The staff was friendly. Additionally, the Italian restaurant in the lobby had great food - try the gnocchi. This hotel was wonderful and a great value for its location. I highly recommend this hotel.
on vacation in New York and DID NOT want to pay full price for a New York hotel (which i have done in the past on business).
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in the City

reviews.text: - another hotwire deal
reviews.title: Great Location for NYC vacation

reviews.text: - paid $120 INCLUDING tax per night, which is unheard of in the city
reviews.title: Decent Hotel in a good area

reviews.text: We stayed at Sheraton Lincoln Harbor for four nights last week while visiting NYC as well as family in NJ. I'm really glad we chose this hotel. We arrived looking, I'm sure, like the beverly hillbillies after a long overnight 15-hour road trip; and were kindly greeted by the front desk staff, including one gentleman who said "Hi, little family!" I wish I'd gotten his name, because though we shuffled by like the zombies we were at that point, his greeting set a really great tone for me from the very beginning.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: The room was fantastic. Super clean, bigger than expected, very nice. We had not booked a "skyline view" room, which was a bit of a disappointment for me that we hadn't, but upon arrival I was thrilled to see that if you looked out of our 10th floor window and slightly to the right, there was the gorgeous skyline. We took great photos from that window. :)
reviews.title: Awesome Views of NYC, Great Price

reviews.text: We ordered room service one evening from the downstairs restaurant (pizza) and it was very good. Another night we inquired at the front desk for local restaurant delivery options, and Wesley was very kind and helpful, giving us several brochures/menus. We had pasta and pizza delivered from Molfetta Pizzeria in Hoboken, and it was very good (as were their prices). We also walked the short distance past the ferry pier to the Riverview Gourmet Deli for coffee and bagels in the mornings, and were also able to buy ginger ale & Pepto there for my son's stomachache without having to drive somewhere & find a drugstore. It's a great little place within walking distance. It's also great that you can just walk right across the street to Ruth's Chris Steakhouse & Houlihan's.
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL FOR VISITING MANHATTAN NYC

reviews.text: The NY Waterway pier being right THERE for the ferry to NY was awesome. The waterfront walkway was also great and I took several early morning walks there, enjoying the views.
reviews.title: great option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our experience and will be back, and have already recommended this hotel to our friends. Thanks for a wonderful trip.
reviews.title: Sheraton Lincoln Harbor Hotel

reviews.text: I'm in NYC once a year for business for 8 days...I had always stayed there because it was so convenient to the Javits Convention Center--the ferry picks you up in front of the hotel (except on weekends) and drops you directly behind the convention center. My convention counterparts were still waiting for a bus by the time I'd be back in my room at the Sheraton Suites.
reviews.title: Stayed There Yearly for 10 Years, and Never Again

likes.liked: — The view of NYC and the convenience of the ferry ON WEEKDAYS ONLY.
likes.disliked: — The weekend shuttle service to the ferry, the cleanliness and the unresponsive staff.

reviews.text: The convenience factor and cost savings are now irrelevant, as I will not stay here ever again, even after such a lengthy relationship with this hotel. Apparently, it went under new management/ownership about 2 years ago. At that time, I noticed a few changes--less of a breakfast, higher rates in the restaurant and slightly diminished customer service. My last stay there this past February, those problems were amplified 10-fold.
reviews.title: What a Dump
poor housekeeping
reviews.text: The worst experience was on the shuttle bus to the main ferry terminal (on the weekends when the ferry doesn't serve Lincoln Harbor)...It used to work like this: I get on the boat in NYC, call the hotel, they said they'd send the shuttle, and by the time we'd walk to the front, the shuttle would be there waiting. Now, there is no consideration given for ferry arrivals. They come once every 45 minutes. Period. The worst case was after a long day on my feet at the tradeshow, arriving to see the shuttle pulling away. We called the hotel and asked for either a second shuttle to be sent (which they do have) or for the guy to come back right after dropping off his current load. Because the tradeshow just closed, there were literally 40-50 of us waiting, which would require a few trips anyway. We were told, "He won't come back for 45 minutes...All of you missed the shuttle departure time". (Mind you, it's a 5-7 minute ride from the hotel to the dock and it is early FEBRUARY in New York, where it's bitter cold and snowing heavily on that particular day).

reviews.title: Not great, not bad.
reviews.text: After we basically did a 'phone tree' having anyone and everyone waiting call the hotel, they did send the shuttle back about a half-hour later. The next day, same thing--"Oh, he was just there, he'll be back in 45 minutes". Ridiculous.
They used to offer a fairly nice hot breakfast included with your rate. This year they took that away without any notification.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient

reviews.text: Three of my friends and I stayed at the Sheraton Suites on the Hudson from July 4 to 7. We were mainly looking for a cheaper hotel than what we could find in Manhattan. We needed three beds, so having the opportunity to stay somewhere without having to pay for two rooms was great.
reviews.title: Great for the location

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and service at the bar and restaurant
likes.disliked: — Lack of amenities at the of check-in

reviews.text: First: location. We loved to be able to take a bus close to the hotel and arrive in Times Square for $2.55. The bus schedules are good enough that you can show up at the corner and expect a bus within 10-15 minutes at any hour. The only problem is that, if you want to take a cab back from NYC, most drivers will charge you around $50 (to get out of the city and pay for the toll).
reviews.title: Impressive

likes.liked: — The view and the space, ferry to NYC right outside

reviews.title: Good, but will stay somewhere else next time
reviews.text: Second: the room. When we got there, we weren't so excited. There was no mattress in the sofa bed, we couldn't open the safe and we only had enough stuff (towels, glasses, etc.) for two people. Fortunately, we only had to make a quick call and all problems were solved almost immediately. After that, our room was always fully supplied and very clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Third: service. The service at the bar and restaurant is excellent! Everyone is very friendly and they'll gladly accomodate any requests (as long as they're reasonable, of course). At the front desk, the staff is also friendly, but doesn't seem very knowledgeable about the area. For questions, I strongly recommend using the touch-screen at the reception desk before seeking help from the staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Location Great Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of warnings for people staying in the Sheraton: Watch your phone charges because calling NYC can cost you a small fortune. I also found the base rate for local calls to be quite expensive. Also, bring a map of Weehawken if you're driving to the hotel. We got lost on the way there, and the streets are almost impossible to navigate in the area.
reviews.title: Worth the trip across the water !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Sheraton Suites on the Hudson. We had a 6th floor room in the tower. Wonderful view of the Manhattan skyline. The ferry (M-F) is steps outside the hotel door and runs every 15 minutes. You'll save more than the $14 round-trip ferry ticket just on the room rate. On the weekends you catch the hotel shuttle to the other dock which was not a problem. We had a car this trip so we just drove one day and parked ($4) at the other ferry terminal.
reviews.title: Great stay, great view!
Sterile
reviews.text: The hotel was what I expected for this type of property. As I read the other reviews I wonder if some people expect all Starwood properties to be like the Westin. The bed was the "Sweet Sleeper" which was great. The bathroom was spotless with plenty of linens. The sofa and chair were comfortable to watch TV (one by the bed also) in the evenings after a long hard day in NYC. :) We ordered room service one evening and the food was OK, nothing great, but not bad either.

I have stayed all over Manhattan and found this hotel to be cleaner than most and a very good price. If you're someone who goes back to your room several times a day, this hotel won't be convenient. If you don't have a car (and who needs one in NYC) then grab your snacks for the night before you head back to the hotel since there is very little open in the evenings within walking distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: Overall, a great stay. We'll be back.
reviews.title: watch out

likes.disliked: — management of the property, disorganized and rude

reviews.text: For $180/night - as close to Manhattan as it is - this place is a good deal. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, but the rooms are quite large and comfy and the staff is friendly (although it may be a
reviews.title: Had a nice stay

description: Soak in the stunning New York City skyline right from the windows of The Sheraton Lincoln Harbor Hotel. Indulge in the spectacular attractions in the city that never sleeps.
